data.chText: 一瞥；一看
data.enText: a look at sb/sth for a very short time, when you do not see the person or thing completely

data.chText: 他一眼瞥见她在人群里。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.

data.chText: 我登上甲板第一次看这岛。
data.enText: I came up on deck to get my first glimpse of the island.

data.chText: 短暂的感受（或体验、领会）
data.enText: a short experience of sth that helps you to understand it

data.chText: 对海洋生物的一次短暂而动人心魄的感受
data.enText: a fascinating glimpse into life in the ocean

data.chText: 这个节目使我们难得地体会伟大艺术家工作时的情况。
data.enText: The programme gives us a rare glimpse of a great artist at work.

data.chText: 瞥见；看一眼
data.enText: to see sb/sth for a moment, but not very clearly

data.chText: 他路过时透过窗户瞥见了她。
data.enText: He'd glimpsed her through the window as he passed.

data.chText: 开始领悟；开始认识到
data.enText: to start to understand sth

data.chText: 她突然开始了解到她姐姐的真实情况。
data.enText: Suddenly she glimpsed the truth about her sister.

data.text: look ♦ glance ♦ gaze ♦ stare ♦ glimpse ♦ glare

data.chText: 以上各词均表示看的动作。
data.enText: These are all words for an act of looking, when you turn your eyes in a particular direction.
look

data.chText: 指看、瞧：
data.enText: an act of looking at sb/sth

data.chText: 来，看一看这个。
data.enText: Here, have a look at this.
glance

data.chText: 指匆匆一看、一瞥、扫视：
data.enText: a quick look

data.chText: 她偷偷看了看表。
data.enText: She stole a glance at her watch.
gaze

data.chText: 指凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long steady look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她在他凝视的目光下感到很尴尬。
data.enText: She felt embarrassed under his steady gaze.
stare

data.chText: 尤指不友善或吃惊的盯、凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long look at sb/sth, especially in a way that is unfriendly or that shows surprise

data.chText: 她面无表情地盯着那官员，耸了耸肩。
data.enText: She gave the officer a blank stare and shrugged her shoulders.
glimpse

data.chText: 指一瞥、一看：
data.enText: a look at sb/sth for a very short time, when you do not see the person or thing completely

data.chText: 他在人群里一眼瞥见了她。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.
glare

data.chText: 指长久的怒视、瞪眼：
data.enText: a long angry look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她敌意地瞪着向她提问的人。
data.enText: She fixed her questioner with a hostile glare.
a look/glance/gaze/stare/glare at sth
a glimpse of sb/sth
with a look/glance/stare/glare
a long/penetrating/piercing look/glance/gaze/stare/glare
a brief look/glance/glimpse/glare
to give sb a look/glance/stare/glare
to have/get/take/sneak/steal a look/glance/glimpse
to avoid sb's look/glance/gaze/stare

data.text: see ♦ spot ♦ catch ♦ glimpse ♦ clap/lay/set eyes on

data.chText: 以上各词均含看见、见到、看出之义，尤指突然发现或注意到。
data.enText: These words all mean to become aware of sb/sth by using your eyes, especially suddenly or when it is not easy to see them/it.
see

data.chText: 指看见、见到、看出：
data.enText: to become aware of sb/sth by using your eyes

data.chText: 她在人群里找来找去，但没看见他。
data.enText: She looked for him but couldn't see him in the crowd.

data.chText: 他看得出她哭过。
data.enText: He could see (that) she had been crying.
spot

data.chText: 指看见、看出，尤指突然发现或注意到：
data.enText: to see or notice sb/sth, especially suddenly or when they are not easy to see or notice

data.chText: 我刚才在封面上发现了一处错误。
data.enText: I've just spotted a mistake on the front cover.
catch

data.chText: 指瞥见、察觉：
data.enText: to see or notice sth for a moment, but not clearly or completely

data.chText: 她瞥见远处有一辆车。
data.enText: She caught sight of a car in the distance.

data.chText: 他看了一眼镜子中的自己。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of himself in the mirror.
glimpse

data.chText: 指瞥见、看一眼：
data.enText: ( literary ) to see sb/sth for a moment, but not clearly or completely

data.chText: 他路过时透过窗户瞥见了她。
data.enText: He'd glimpsed her through the window as he passed.
clap/lay/set eyes on sb/sth

data.chText: （通常用于否定句中）指看见、注意到：
data.enText: ( informal ) (usually used in negative statements) to see sb/sth

data.chText: 我几个星期都没见到他们了。
data.enText: I haven't clapped eyes on them for weeks.
to see/spot that/how/what/where/who…
to suddenly see/spot/catch/glimpse sb/sth
can/could see
to fail to see/spot

means: 短暂的感受(或体验、领会)

ex.chText: 她向房间四周看了一眼才离开。
ex.enText: She glanced about the room before she left.

ex.chText: 她从他身边走过时，他快速地瞟了她一眼。
ex.enText: He glanced at her as she passed by.
He glimpsed a figure at the window.

ex.chText: 在她即将消失在人群中时，我瞥见了她。
ex.enText: I glimpsed her among the crowd before she disappeared from sight.

synonyms.bx: 指一瞥之下看见某人或某物，但未看清全貌。

ex.chText: 哈里从窗户往厨房里窥视。
ex.enText: Harry peeped through the window into the kitchen.
He peeped through the key hole.

synonyms.bx: 尤指通过孔眼、缝隙等迅速地偷窥。

example: from the window he could catch a glimpse of the lake
he caught only a glimpse of the professor's meaning

tr: catch a glimpse of or see briefly
example: We glimpsed the Queen as she got into her limousine

value.def: If you get a glimpse of someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well.

example.ex: Some of the fans had waited 24 hours outside the Hyde Park Hotel to catch a glimpse of their heroine.
example.tran: 为了一睹女主角的风采，一些追星族已经在海德公园饭店外守候了24个小时。

value.def: If you glimpse someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well.

example.ex: She glimpsed a group of people standing on the bank of a river.
example.tran: 她瞥见一群人站在河岸边。

value.def: A glimpse of something is a brief experience of it or an idea about it that helps you understand or appreciate it better.

example.ex: As university campuses become increasingly multi-ethnic, they offer a glimpse of the conflicts society will face tomorrow.
example.tran: 大学校园变得日益多种族化，通过校园可以对未来社会将要面对的诸多冲突有一个初步的认识。

value.tran: 短暂的感受；初步的认识
